meanings.definition: The state or quality of being involuntary.
meanings.sent1: Her involuntariness to laugh at the joke was evident to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The involuntariness of his reflexes surprised the doctors.
meanings.sent3: The cat's involuntariness to chase the laser pointer provided endless entertainment for the family.
meanings.sent4: The storm's sudden arrival showcased the involuntariness of nature's power.
meanings.sent5: The involuntariness of the sneeze caught her by surprise.

meanings.definition: The inability to control or prevent something.
meanings.sent1: The student's involuntariness to stop the pencil from rolling off the desk amused his classmates.
meanings.sent2: His involuntariness to resist the temptation of chocolate was well-known among his friends.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's involuntariness to stay still during bath time turned the bathroom into a splash zone.
meanings.sent4: The invincible superhero suddenly faced an involuntariness to use his powers in the presence of kryptonite.
meanings.sent5: The involuntariness of the yawn spread quickly through the sleepy audience.
